intro: Monopsis scabra var. albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered monopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
